result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. BOBI J. HIRSCHFIELD

records.addlTxt:
3:02 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant BOBI J. HIRSCHFIELD appeared by phone.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for BOBI J. HIRSCHFIELD.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case recalled. 
Attorney Gill is heard. Defendant waives reading of the information. Defendant will enter pleas of not guilty. Clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count. 

Court cancels warrant.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury status hearing on December 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:04 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant BOBI J. HIRSCHFIELD not in court.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for BOBI J. HIRSCHFIELD.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Gill is heard on the non appearance of the defendant. Attorney Gill called defendant to leave a message. 
Court orders a warrant, defendant to be held for further hearing.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:22 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant BOBI J. HIRSCHFIELD appeared by phone.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Cheryl Gill appeared by video for defendant

Court reviews waiver of preliminary hearing and questionnaire form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, 

Court finds probable cause and binds def. over for trial

Atty. Gill waives reading, and states Def. will enter plea of not guilty

Court advises that her policy is to wait until the information is filed to take the plea

Court schedules Jury status hearing 
Hearing is concluded and Atty Gill leaves call.  Court realizes plea was not entered 
Information filed at this time. 
Court attempts to reach Atty. Gill and is unable to do so.  Jury status is changed to an Arraignment
Arraignment scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:45 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant BOBI J. HIRSCHFIELD appeared by video.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for BOBI J. HIRSCHFIELD.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Gill is heard. Needs to continue preliminary hearing to another date.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel - Attorney Cheryl Gill

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.

9:02 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Bobi Jo Hirschfield appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Cheryl Gill appeared for defendant Bobi Jo Hirschfield by video. 

Case 22GF179 called. 

Attorney Gill is heard on motion. 
Attorney Steiner is heard and opposes. 

Attorney Steiner is heard. Has filed criminal complaint. 
Clerk brought over criminal complaint. Case 22CF110 created.
Case number 22CF110 called for an initial appearance.  

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  

Court modifies bond to a $500.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:23 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Bobi Jo Hirschfield appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Jeffrey Erickson appears via video for Def.
     Court finds probable cause.
     D.A. requests $1,000 cash bond, not possess/consume any controlled substance; testing by L.E. as requested.  Notes cases in Vernon County with several warrants and a $2,000 cash bond there.
     Atty. Erickson comments; states has moved to Soldiers Grove; comments on Vernon Cty. cases.
     Court orders cash bond of $1,000.00; not possess/consume any controlled substances unless specifically prescribed; must submit to UAs as requested by L.E.; if test positive or refuses, must submit to a blood draw.
     Court concludes at 1:28 p.m.
Hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant not to possess/consume any controlled substances unless specifically prescribed; must submit to UAs as requested by L.E.; if test positive or refuses, must submit to a blood draw.
